Removed fact tag - the passage summarises sourced statements from the section headed "Hahnemann's concept".
claim needs sourcing
As per [[WP:LEAD]], the lead sentence should be a simple definition. Move other stuff to later or to quote box. See [[Wikipedia:Peer review/Homeopathy/archive3#Review of the lead by Eubulides]].
Standardize on periods at the ends of citations; this seemed to be the majority.
Coalesce duplicate citations.
For scholarly journals and books, list just the year; the month and day are misleading noise for these sources.
/* Research on medical effectiveness */ Lower-case journal article title.
Standardize on ISO date format for accessdate= (the majority of uses).
In citations, use accessdate= (which is documented) instead of access-date= (which is not). No change to visible appearance.
/* Research on medical effectiveness */ Hyphen for page range.
/* Research on medical effectiveness */ Omit page count in pages=
Standardize on PubMed abbreviations for journal titles (when available).
Wikilink just the 1st occurrence of a name in citations (e.g., [[Edzard Ernst]]), as per [[WP:OVERLINK]].
/* High dilutions */ (ec) cite gnoming
/* Regulation and prevalence */ Replace ".." with "." in citation.
Standardize on medical style for authors of sources (Lastname INI, Lastname INI).
/* See also */ Remove [[Homeopathic dilutions]], as it's wikilinked multiple times elsewhere and isn't needed here. See [[WP:SEEALSO]].
/* Remedies */ Turn a non-sentence into a sentence.
Standardize on "U.S." (it was also spelled "US" and "USA" in places).
/* Dilution and succussion */ Fix misspelling of "Hahnemann".
m fix grammar/readability in image caption
